REBATE MANAGEMENT
Compensate Your Partners for Competitive Pricing with Special Prices and Discounts

Rebate program managers can create special pricing terms to define flat discounts and reference prices for partners when partners sell competitively priced products. Rebate program managers can create special pricing term benefits to craft nuanced, tiered incentive structures and differentiate benefits by the product quantity sold, the period the product was sold in, or both.

How Do Special Pricing Terms and Benefits Work?
Understand what are special pricing terms and special pricing term benefits and how they work together to create a tiered ship and debit incentive structure.
Create a Special Pricing Term
Rebate program managers can create special pricing terms to compensate partners when partners sell competitively priced products to end-customers. Define the products and program members that are eligible for special pricing terms. Specify the maximum quantity of a product that’s eligible for the special pricing term. Specify either the reference price per unit or the discount and discount by percent values for a special pricing term.
Create a Special Pricing Term Benefit
Rebate program managers can create special pricing term benefits for a special pricing term to define a tiered ship and debit incentive structure with qualifying ranges and incentives for each range. Differentiate the reference prices or discounts that partners get by the quantity of products they sell, the period they sell the products in, or both.

title: Streamlining Rebate Management and Special Pricing
